Title: YouTube will help you quit watching Shorts
Description:
YouTube has added a new Shorts feature that makes it easier to manage how much time you’re spending watching videos.
Mobile users can now set a customizable daily limit that restricts how long they can scroll Shorts feeds, aiming to help viewers better manage…

Title: Scientists Have Cracked the Mystery of Snake Pee
Description:
Reptiles produce crystal "pee," which, in humans, would cause gout or kidney stones.
But this seems to be working out great for them.

Title: Gaza health crisis will last for 'generations', WHO chief warns
Description: Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus tells the BBC far more aid is needed to start tackling mounting problems in Gaza.

Title: Samsung's Galaxy XR Mixed Reality Headset Now Available for $1,800
Description:
Samsung today announced the launch of the Galaxy XR, a new mixed reality headset that will compete with the Apple Vision Pro.
At $1,800, the Galaxy XR is $1,700 cheaper than the new M5 Vision Pro, but it is much more expensive than Meta's Quest VR devices.

Title: It's not just Florida. Real estate boomtowns are going bust.
Description:
The real estate market has split in two.
Sunny winners of the work-from-home reshuffle, like Tampa, Phoenix, and Atlanta, are no longer on top.

Title: Florida moves to end childhood vaccination mandates. Doctors brace for impact
Description:
Florida announced plans to end mandatory vaccination.
Now scientists are assessing which of several diseases deadly to children are likely to make a resurgence and when.

Title: How Word Choice and Effort Make Apologies Sound Genuine, according to Psychologists
Description: The words we choose when apologizing—especially longer, effortful ones—can signal sincerity and make our apologies feel more authentic.

Title: Sam Altman was right, the 'Dead Internet Theory' could kill the web within 3 years — "LLMs can suffer from brain rot!"
Description: A Cornell University study reveals that the prolonged exposure of large language models to low-quality training data negatively impacts accuracy, comprehension, and thought process.

Title: Microsoft prepares major Windows 11 feature drop with new Start menu, Taskbar updates, and more | New features expected to roll out next month
Description: Windows 11's next major update is set to include a brand-new Start menu, lots of Taskbar and File Explorer updates, and general quality of life improvements, which is now in the final testing stages before general availability.

Title: What makes PhD students happy? Good supervision
Description: Supervisors who invest in positive mentoring relationships with their PhD candidates also reap the benefits for their own research.
